metadata.court: Superior Court of San Diego County

charges.description: Driving under the influence of alcohol
charges.potential_sentence: Up to 6 months jail, 3-5 years probation, fines, DUI school

arrest.location: Pacific Coast Highway & La Jolla Blvd, San Diego
arrest.circumstances: Traffic stop for alleged 'weaving within lane'

statements_made: I had two glasses of wine with dinner

discovery_received.summary: Officer narrative of stop, field sobriety tests, and arrest

discovery_outstanding: Officer Martinez training and certification records

constitutional_issues.description: Questionable basis for traffic stop - 'weaving within lane' is not necessarily a violation. Officer may lack reasonable suspicion.
evidence: Police report states 'weaving within lane' but no actual traffic violation cited
Stop initiated at 11:45 PM - possible pretext stop

constitutional_issues.description: Title 17 compliance - need to verify 15-minute observation period and device calibration
evidence: Test administered 45 minutes after stop - verify observation was continuous

matter.defense_theory: Client had two glasses of wine over 3-hour dinner, finishing at 9 PM. Stop occurred at 11:45 PM, over 2.5 hours later. No erratic driving. 'Weaving within lane' insufficient for reasonable suspicion under People v. Perez. BAC test may violate Title 17 regulations if observation period was interrupted.

goals.primary: Dismissal via suppression of stop and/or BAC test
goals.fallback: Standard first-time DUI with minimal penalties

matter.client_narrative: I had dinner with friends at a restaurant in La Jolla. I had two glasses of wine between 6 PM and 9 PM with food. I left around 11:30 PM to drive home. I was not driving erratically. The officer said I was 'weaving' but I was just changing lanes normally to get into the left turn lane. I was nervous during the field sobriety tests because I have a bad knee from an old soccer injury. I don't think I was impaired when I was driving.
